_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PANEL
name: LazyMC
author: efina@efina.eu.org
description: LazyMC is a proxy that puts your Minecraft server to sleep when no players are online and wakes it up automatically when someone connects. This egg supports freeze mode (pause/resume without full restart), configurable join handling methods, MOTD customization per server state, RCON-based graceful shutdown, and banned IP enforcement — all configured via environment variables.

variables.name: Block Banned IPs
variables.description: Reject connections from IPs listed in banned-ips.json inside the server directory. Blocked clients receive the configured ban reason message on connect.

variables.name: Config Version
variables.description: lazymc configuration schema version this egg targets. Do not modify unless you are intentionally upgrading to a new lazymc config format.

variables.name: Drop Banned IPs
variables.description: Silently drop TCP connections from banned IPs at the network level, preventing them from pinging or querying server status. Unlike Block Banned IPs, clients see a generic 'Disconnected' with no ban reason. Requires Block Banned IPs to also be enabled.

variables.name: Forge Mode
variables.description: Enable compatibility mode for Forge-based servers. Required for the lobby join method to function with Forge; may not be compatible with all mods.

variables.name: Freeze Process
variables.description: Freeze (pause) the server process when all players leave instead of shutting it down, allowing it to resume much faster on next join. Only effective on Linux/macOS; silently ignored on Windows.

variables.name: Game Protocol
variables.description: Minecraft protocol number matching the Game Version above, shown to clients while the server is sleeping. Find the correct number at https://git.io/J1Fvx

variables.name: Game Version
variables.description: Minecraft version string shown to clients while the server is sleeping. Once the real server starts and its version is detected, this value is replaced automatically. Reference: https://git.io/J1Fvx

variables.name: Hold Timeout
variables.description: Seconds to hold a connecting client in a loading state while the server starts. Must be kept below 30 seconds or the Minecraft client will time out and disconnect. If the server starts within this window, the client connects seamlessly.

variables.name: Join Methods
variables.description: Methods used to handle a connecting client while the server starts. Methods are applied in order; if none are set, the client disconnects with no message. Available values: hold, kick, forward. For multiple methods, use comma-separated values (e.g. hold,kick). For a single method, wrap in brackets (e.g. [kick]) — a bare value like kick is treated as a plain string and will fail to parse.

variables.name: Kick Message (Starting)
variables.description: Message sent to a client that is kicked while the server is starting. Supports Minecraft color codes (§c = red, §r = reset) and \n for line breaks.
variables.default_value:
Server is starting... §c♥§r

This may take some time.

Please try to reconnect in a minute.

variables.name: Kick Message (Stopping)
variables.description: Message sent to a client that is kicked while the server is stopping / going to sleep. Supports Minecraft color codes (§7 = gray, §r = reset) and \n for line breaks.
variables.default_value:
Server is going to sleep... §7☠§r

Please try to reconnect in a minute to wake it again.

variables.name: Lockout Enabled
variables.description: Block all incoming connections and instantly kick any player who tries to join. Useful during maintenance. When enabled, no one can connect regardless of whitelist or other settings.

variables.name: Lockout Message
variables.description: Kick message shown to players when Lockout is enabled. Supports Minecraft color codes (§7 = gray, §r = reset) and \n for line breaks.
variables.default_value:
Server is closed §7☠§r

Please try to reconnect in a minute.

variables.name: MOTD (Sleeping)
variables.description: Server list MOTD displayed while the server is sleeping. Use § followed by a color code for formatting (e.g. §2 = green, §7 = gray, §r = reset) and \n for a line break. Maximum 2 lines.
variables.default_value:
☠ Server is sleeping
§2☻ Join to start it up

variables.name: MOTD (Starting)
variables.description: Server list MOTD displayed while the server is starting up. Use § followed by a color code for formatting (e.g. §2 = green, §7 = gray, §r = reset) and \n for a line break. Maximum 2 lines.

variables.name: MOTD (Stopping)
variables.description: Server list MOTD displayed while the server is shutting down / going to sleep. Use § followed by a color code for formatting (e.g. §2 = green, §7 = gray, §r = reset) and \n for a line break. Maximum 2 lines.
variables.default_value:
☠ Server going to sleep...
⌛ Please wait...

variables.name: MOTD from Server
variables.description: Once the real server's MOTD has been detected (after its first start), use it for all server list responses instead of the static MOTDs defined above.

variables.name: Minimum Online Time
variables.description: Minimum seconds the server must remain online after starting, even if all players leave immediately. Prevents rapid sleep/wake cycles.

variables.name: Probe on Start
variables.description: Connect to the Minecraft server briefly on lazymc startup to detect its real version and protocol. Improves compatibility with some clients. Automatically enabled when required by other settings (e.g. Wake on Start). Note: this wakes the server once on lazymc launch.

variables.name: RCON Enabled
variables.description: Allow lazymc to stop the server gracefully via RCON instead of OS signals. Required on Windows since process signals are not supported there. On Linux, RCON is optional but can improve shutdown reliability.

variables.name: RCON Password
variables.description: Password for the server's RCON interface. Leave empty to let lazymc generate a random password on each start via RCON Randomize Password. Tip: set via environment variable to avoid storing secrets in the panel.

variables.name: RCON Port
variables.description: Port lazymc uses to connect to the server's RCON interface. Must be different from both the public port and the internal server port, and must match the value set in server.properties.

variables.name: RCON Randomize Password
variables.description: Generate a new random RCON password on every lazymc start and inject it into server.properties automatically. Recommended when no fixed RCON Password is set. Has no effect if a fixed password is provided.

variables.name: Rewrite Server Properties
variables.description: Automatically update server.properties entries that lazymc requires (e.g. server-port, rcon.port, rcon.password, enable-rcon). Recommended to keep enabled; disable only if you manage server.properties entirely by hand.

variables.name: Server Startup Command
variables.description: Command lazymc uses to start the Minecraft server. Use --nogui to suppress the server GUI window. Adjust -Xmx / -Xms to set max/min JVM heap memory.

variables.name: Sleep After
variables.description: Number of seconds with no players online before lazymc puts the server to sleep (or freezes it if Freeze Process is enabled).

variables.name: Start Timeout
variables.description: Maximum seconds to wait for the server to finish starting. If the server has not become ready within this time, lazymc force-kills the process.

variables.name: Stop Timeout
variables.description: Maximum seconds to wait for the server to finish stopping. If the server has not exited within this time, lazymc force-kills the process.

variables.name: Wake Whitelist
variables.description: When true, only players listed in the Minecraft server's whitelist can wake a sleeping server. Players not on the whitelist are rejected before the server starts. Has no effect if the server's whitelist feature is disabled.

variables.name: Wake on Crash
variables.description: Automatically restart the Minecraft server if it exits unexpectedly. Disabled by default to avoid restart loops on persistent crashes.

variables.name: Wake on Start
variables.description: Start the Minecraft server immediately when lazymc itself starts, without waiting for a player to connect. Also implicitly enables Probe on Start.
